title: Mário Pečalka
text:
Mário Pečalka (born 28 December 1980) is a former <a href="Slovakia">Slovak</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender.
Career.
Pečalka began playing football in his hometown club OFK Rudina. Later he moved to Kysucké Nové Mesto and then he played for the <a href="Czech%20Fourth%20Division">Czech Fourth Division</a> team <a href="FK%20Mut%C4%9Bnice">FK Mutěnice</a>. In 2003, he came back to his home region to play for the <a href="Slovak%20Fourth%20League">Slovak Fourth League</a> team TJ Slovan Rudinská. In 2004, he was on loan in <a href="%C5%A0K%20Slovan%20Bratislava">Slovan Bratislava</a> which was playing in the <a href="Slovak%20Second%20League">Slovak Second League</a> in this time. After end of loan he signed for the <a href="Slovak%20First%20League">Corgoň Liga</a> club <a href="M%C5%A0K%20%C5%BDilina">MŠK Žilina</a>. He played for Žilina in 103 matches overall, scoring 4 goals. He twice won the Slovak title in Žilina. He became one of the best Corgoň Liga defenders and was selected to the <a href="Slovakia%20national%20football%20team">national team</a> in 2009. He played 5 group matches in the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">2010–11 UEFA Champions League</a>. In February 2011, he signed for <a href="Israel">Israel</a>i club <a href="Hapoel%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Hapoel Tel Aviv</a>. He made his debut for Hapoel in a 2–0 win against <a href="Maccabi%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.">Maccabi Petah Tikva</a> on 14 February 2011. In January 2012, he signed on loan at <a href="%C5%A0K%20Slovan%20Bratislava">Slovan Bratislava</a> for half a year. In May 2013, he announced the end of his professional career due persistent back problems.
International career.
Pečalka made his national team debut in a 2–3 defeat against <a href="Ukraine%20national%20football%20team">Ukraine</a> on 10 February 2009. He was called up to the Slovakia preliminary squad for the <a href="2010%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2010 FIFA World Cup</a> but manager <a href="Vladim%C3%ADr%20Weiss%20%28footballer%20born%201964%29">Vladimír Weiss</a> did not select him for the final tournament squad.
